title: Ministry of Primary Resources and Tourism
text:
The Ministry of Primary Resources and Tourism (MPRT; ) is a <a href="ministries%20of%20Brunei">ministry</a> in the <a href="Government%20of%20Brunei">Government of Brunei</a> which oversees the development of agricultural and fishing industries, forestry management as well as <a href="tourism%20in%20Brunei">tourism</a>. The current Minister of Primary Resources and Tourism is Ali <a href="patronymic%23Southeast%20Asia">bin</a> Apong, who has been appointed since 2015 and retained office during the 2018 <a href="cabinet%20of%20Brunei">cabinet</a> reshuffle.
Background.
The ministry was previously known as the Ministry of Industry and Primary Resources (MIPR; ) until the renaming to its present name to reflect functional restructuring, in which oversight for the petroleum and non-primary industries has been transferred, at that time to <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20Office%20%28Brunei%29">Prime Minister's Office</a>. It is also to reflect the emphasis on the development of tourism industry.

Budget.
The budget for the ministry in the current fiscal year (2018–19) is <a href="Brunei%20dollar">B$</a>54 million (<a href="United%20States%20dollar">US$</a>39 million as of December 2018). It has the smallest budget allocation among the ministries for that year.
